item.title: 大风暴给中西部地区带来大雪，芝加哥取消航班
item.description: 周六，一场大风暴给美国中西部地区带来了寒冬，一年中最繁忙的旅行周末之一与大风暴相撞，芝加哥及周边地区数百个航班被取消，道路变得险象环生。【原文：Hundreds of flights have been canceled in and around Chicago and roads are becoming treacherous as one of the busiest travel weekends of the year collides with a major storm bringing wintery conditions throughout the US Midwest Saturday.】

item.title: 巴西咖啡种植者更换品种以适应更炎热的世界
item.description: 无论您是咖啡爱好者，还是咖啡馆的 "死忠"，咖啡都是全世界数十亿人必不可少的晨间仪式。在喝第一杯咖啡之前，新的一天是否已经开始？值得商榷。【原文：Whether you’re a pourover snob or a diner sludge diehard, coffee is an essential morning ritual for billions of people around the world. Does the day even start before the first cup? Debatable, really.】

item.title: 世界顶级咖啡生产商为何更换咖啡豆
item.description:
气候变化使巴西最重要的咖啡出口产品阿拉伯咖啡的种植变得更加困难。【原文：

Climate change is making it more difficult to grow arabica, Brazil’s top coffee export.

】

item.title: 公用事业股在人工智能泡沫担忧中摇摆不定
item.description: 人工智能的蓬勃发展有利于数据中心所依赖的东西，比如电力。今年以来，公用事业类股飙升，因为公司希望从数据中心的巨大能源需求中套现。但科技股的回落也拖累了公用事业股。【原文：The AI boom has been good for things data centers rely on, like electricity. Utility stocks have soared this year as companies look to cash in on data centers’ voracious energy demand. But tech stocks pulling back have dragged utilities down, too.】

item.title: 天奇在 SQM 之争中保持国际仲裁大门敞开
item.description: 天齐锂业公司（Tianqi Lithium Corp.天齐锂业首席执行官弗兰克-哈（Frank Ha）对向国际法庭起诉智利 SQM 公司的可能性持开放态度。【原文：Tianqi Lithium Corp. Chief Executive Officer Frank Ha is keeping the door open to the possibility of taking a case against Chile’s SQM to an international tribunal.】

item.title: 日本总督批准重启北海道核电站
item.description: 日本北海道岛上唯一的核电站获得了当地知事的关键性支持，使日本最北端地区重启原子能发电的进程更近了一步。【原文：The only nuclear plant on the Japanese island of Hokkaido has won the crucial endorsement of the local governor, bringing the restart of atomic power generation a step closer in the country’s northernmost region.】

item.title: 资金饥渴的印尼将减少外国投资者的障碍
item.description: 印尼准备简化措施，吸引更多外国投资者和银行参与减排项目，即将发布的白皮书提出了印尼吸引私人资本实现气候目标的步骤。【原文：Indonesia is poised to streamline measures to draw more foreign investors and banks into emissions-cutting projects, with a forthcoming white paper laying out steps to attract the private capital it needs to meet its climate goals.】

item.title: 具有里程碑意义的澳大利亚环境法案获得参议院通过，即将成为法律
item.description: 在澳大利亚总理安东尼-阿尔巴内斯的政府与左翼少数党绿党达成协议后，澳大利亚议会上院通过了一项具有里程碑意义的法案，以全面修订该国的环境法。【原文：Australia’s upper house of parliament has passed a landmark bill to overhaul the nation’s environmental laws after Prime Minister Anthony Albanese’s government struck a deal with the left-wing minority Greens party.】

item.title: 越南薄弱的防洪能力正被日益加剧的风暴压垮
item.description: 今年，越南遭遇了一场又一场特大暴雨，其中一场几乎创下了全球降雨量纪录。这些灾害使越南及其薄弱的防御系统陷入困境。今天的时事通讯将探讨越南在适应气候变化方面所面临的代价高昂的挑战，其他国家也在努力应对这一问题。【原文：Vietnam has faced extreme storm after extreme storm this year, including one that nearly set a global rainfall record. The disasters have left the country and its scant defenses reeling. Today’s newsletter looks at the costly challenges Vietnam faces in adapting to climate change, a problem other nations are also grappling with.】

item.title: 澳大利亚面临不大幅减排就无法实现 2035 年气候目标的风险
item.description: 澳大利亚警告说，如果不进一步削减污染，就有可能无法实现2035年的气候目标，这反过来又会威胁到该国到本世纪中叶实现净零排放的雄心。【原文：Australia warned it’s in danger of missing its 2035 climate targets without deeper pollution cuts, which in turn threatens the nation’s ambitions to reach net zero by mid-century.】

item.title: 干旱持续，澳大利亚夏季野火风险升高
item.description: 一项季节性展望显示，澳大利亚部分地区今年夏天将面临更高的野火风险，葡萄酒产区、沿海城镇以及用于放牧和种植谷物的农田都将受到威胁。【原文：Some parts of Australia are facing heightened wildfire risks this summer, threatening wine-producing regions, coastal towns, and agricultural land used for grazing and grain, according to a seasonal outlook.】

item.title: 澳大利亚将通过具有里程碑意义的法案全面修订环境法
item.description: 澳大利亚总理安东尼-阿尔巴尼塞（Anthony Albanese）领导的政府在今年议会最后一天的会议上获得了左翼绿党的支持，澳大利亚将通过一项具有里程碑意义的法案，对环境法进行全面改革。【原文：Australia is set to pass a landmark bill that will overhaul its environmental laws after Prime Minister Anthony Albanese’s government secured support from the left-wing Greens party on the last sitting day of parliament for the year.】

item.title: 美国环保局新规给予石油天然气公司更多时间修复泄漏甲烷的设备
item.description: 美国环保署周三最终确定了一项规定，给予石油和天然气运营商一年多的额外时间来遵守前总统乔-拜登制定的更换泄漏设备和定期监测甲烷泄漏的规定。【原文：The Environmental Protection Agency on Wednesday finalized a rule granting oil and gas operators more than a year in additional time to comply with mandates set by former President Joe Biden to replace leaky equipment and routinely monitor for escaped methane.】

item.title: 致命风暴和 30 亿美元损失考验越南的气候防御能力
item.description: 今年，越南遭受了一系列致命灾害和历史性洪水的袭击，损失至少达 30 亿美元，暴露了该国脆弱的气候防御能力，而就在此时，另一场风暴正向该地区袭来。【原文：Vietnam has been pounded by a series of deadly disasters and historic floods this year that have racked up at least $3 billion in losses and exposed the nation’s flimsy climate defenses, just as another storm bears down on the region.】

item.title: 巴西的席尔瓦说，美国的缺席损害了在 COP30 上推动化石燃料退出的努力
item.description:
该国环境部长表示，美国的 "引力 "破坏了联合国气候谈判的一项关键提案。【原文：

The country’s environment minister said the “gravitational pull” of the US helped undermine a key proposal at the UN climate talks. 

】

item.title: 英国为核电被视为 "绿色 "扫清债券市场道路
item.description: 英国将首次允许将绿色债券销售所得资金用于资助核电，这在环保人士中一直被视为有争议的举措。【原文：The UK will for the first time allow money generated from green-bond sales to go toward financing nuclear power, taking a step long seen as controversial among environmentalists.】

item.title: 暴风雨导致中西部停电，威胁感恩节出行
item.description: 在美国准备迎接一年中最繁忙的旅行日之一--感恩节假期前夕之际，大雪和狂风正在美国中西部蔓延，引发停电以及潜在的地面和空中延误。【原文：Snowy and blustery conditions are spreading across the US Midwest, triggering power outages and potential ground and air delays as the US prepares for one of its busiest travel days of the year – the eve of the Thanksgiving holiday.】

item.title: 监督机构称，英国 14 亿英镑的电动汽车里程税将打击需求
item.description: 根据英国预算措施，英国的电动汽车和插电式混合动力汽车车主将被征收每英里付费税，而汽车制造商必须完成电动汽车的销售任务，这可能会抑制需求。【原文：Britain’s electric and plug-in hybrid vehicle owners will be subject to a pay-per-mile tax, under UK budget measures tipped to dent demand at a time when carmakers must meet an EV sales mandate.】

item.title: Brad Lander 建议纽约养老基金抛弃贝莱德
item.description: 纽约最大的养老金管理公司正面临不信任。即将离任的主计长布拉德-兰德（Brad Lander）建议纽约市放弃贝莱德，因为贝莱德在将气候因素纳入投资策略方面做得不够。【原文：New York’s largest pension manager is facing a show of no confidence. Outgoing Comptroller Brad Lander has recommended that the city drop BlackRock because it’s not doing enough to factor climate into its investment strategies.】

item.title: 纽约市兰德建议放弃贝莱德 420 亿美元的授权
item.description: 纽约市主计长布拉德-兰德（Brad Lander）正敦促该市三家养老基金放弃贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：New York City Comptroller Brad Lander is urging three of the city’s pension funds to drop BlackRock Inc. because of “inadequate” climate plans, the latest move to penalize investment firms for failing to tackle global warming.】

item.title: 欧盟议会支持将森林砍伐法规推迟一年实施
item.description: 欧洲议会支持将一项遏制全球森林砍伐的里程碑式法律推迟一年实施，并寻求放宽合规要求，这些要求引起了人们对该措施的行政负担和对贸易影响的担忧。【原文：The European Parliament supported a one-year delay to a landmark law to curb deforestation across the world and sought to soften compliance requirements that have raised concerns about the measure’s administrative burden and impact on trade.】

item.title: 随着联邦支持减少，加州投资廉价热泵
item.description:
州政府将拨款 1 亿多美元，用于创造对租房者和低收入居民负担得起的节能技术的需求。【原文：

The state is allocating more than $100 million to create demand for energy-efficient technologies that renters and low-income residents can afford. 

】

item.title: 施耐德说：美国即将出现的电力紧张将削弱人工智能能力
item.description: 随着数据中心用电需求的激增，以及电网老化和脆弱的冰冷现实，美国将在本十年面临一场潜在的电力危机。【原文：The US faces a potential electricity crisis this decade as a surge in demand to power data centers bumps into the cold reality of aged and vulnerable grids.】

item.title: 中国建造大型风力涡轮机的速度将放缓
item.description: 据行业高管称，由于技术障碍，中国制造商在未来几年建造更大型风力涡轮机的竞赛预计将放缓。【原文：The race among Chinese manufacturers to build ever-larger wind turbines is expected to slow due to technical hurdles in the coming years, according to industry executives.】

item.title: 日本考虑帮助南非资助能源改革
item.description: 日本正在与南非就可能帮助该国为能源部门重组提供资金一事进行谈判。【原文：Japan is in talks with South Africa over potentially helping the country finance the reorganization of its energy sector.】

item.title: 卡尼的石油出口策略取决于修复破碎的碳市场
item.description: 加拿大总理马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）表示，加拿大政府正在与阿尔伯塔省谈判一项协议，为未来建设一条通往加拿大西海岸的新石油管道 "创造必要条件"。【原文：Prime Minister Mark Carney said his government is negotiating an agreement with Alberta that “creates necessary conditions” for the future construction of a new oil pipeline to Canada’s west coast.】

item.title: 特斯拉联合创始人斯特劳贝尔的电池初创公司 Redwood 裁员数十人
item.description: 特斯拉公司联合创始人JB Straubel的电池回收公司Redwood Materials Inc.裁员数十人，因为这家初创公司缩减了一些雄心勃勃的项目，重新专注于开发电网规模的电池需求。【原文：Tesla Inc. co-founder JB Straubel’s battery recycling firm Redwood Materials Inc. cut dozens of jobs as the startup scales back some of its ambitious projects to refocus on tapping into demand for grid-scale batteries.】

item.title: 气候峰会正在按设计运行：效果不佳
item.description:
未来人们将如何记住 COP30？Bloomberg Green的Jennifer Dlouhy和Akshat Rathi在 "零 "播客中进行了讨论。【原文：

How will COP30 be remembered in years to come? Bloomberg Green’s Jennifer Dlouhy and Akshat Rathi discuss on the Zero podcast.

】

item.title: 人工智能如何帮助降低野火风险
item.description: 电线引燃树木是破坏性火灾的主要原因。那么电力公司该怎么办？使用人工智能指导修剪树木。【原文：Powerlines igniting trees is a major cause of destructive fires. So what’s a utility to do? Trim the trees using AI guidance.】

item.title: 葡萄酒需求下降，法国斥资 1.5 亿美元拔除葡萄树
item.description: 法国是世界顶级葡萄酒生产国之一，将拨款 1.3 亿欧元（1.5 亿美元）帮助农民拔除更多的葡萄树，因为气候变化、全球需求疲软和贸易战使这一行业遭受重创。【原文：France, one of the world’s top winemakers, will disburse €130 million ($150 million) to help farmers uproot more vines in a sector hit hard by climate change, weak global demand and trade wars.】
